1.text: To the chief Musician on Neginoth upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David.  O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

2.text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.

3.text: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O LORD, how long?

4.text: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies' sake.

5.text: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?

6.text: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.

7.text: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

8.text: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.

9.text: The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.

10.text: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.
